qas.question: What is a good technique to foster party harmony?
What colleagues are best to work with to reach a consensus?
What does the creation of leadership positions allow for?

answers.text: way to reach out and involve a greater diversity of partisans in the leadership structure

plausible_answers.text: inclusion and empowerment of the people

qas.question: What public need motivates the President before he has daily meetings?
What group is the President responsible for the creation of when elected?
What positions did task forces want to lay out floor strategy for the creation of?
What did task forces for the public want to foster in the minority party?
What did colleagues with conflicing views lay out for task forces?

context: Gephardt added that "<b3_0>inclusion and empowerment of the people<b3_0/> on the line have to be done to get the best performance" from the minority party. Other techniques for fostering <b6_0>party harmony<b6_0/> include the <a0_0>appointment of <b4_0>task forces<b4_0/><a0_0/> composed of <a1_0>partisan colleagues with conflicting views<a1_0/> to reach consensus on issues; the creation of <b5_0>new leadership positions<b5_0/> as a <a2_0>way to reach out and involve a greater diversity of partisans in the leadership structure<a2_0/>; and daily meetings in the Leader's office (or at breakfast, lunch, or dinner) to lay out <b7_0>floor strategy<b7_0/> or political objectives for the minority party.
